title: Sims-Lohman, One of Cincinnati’s Largest Private Companies, Announces Nashville Acquisition
text:
CINCINNATI--(BUSINESS WIRE)-- Cincinnati based Sims-Lohman, the nation’s largest provider of kitchen cabinets and granite and quartz countertops to building professionals, has acquired Werthan Granite in Nashville, Tennessee.
Sims-Lohman has 20 sales showroom locations across six states. They have three regional distribution centers and now, five state-of-the-art granite and quartz countertop manufacturing plants.
John Beiersdorfer, Sims-Lohman’s President, said, “We entered the Tennessee markets of Nashville and Knoxville and the Huntsville, Alabama market with our cabinet offerings in 2015 and have had tremendous success in growing these southern markets at a 20+% pace each year since. Werthan Granite provides our Southern Region a missing piece of the puzzle with a first-class granite and quartz countertop fabrication operation that can serve both our Tennessee and Alabama markets. In addition, Werthan has a solid surface operation serving commercial customers and a tile component. We are very excited to welcome Werthan’s team members and customers to the Sims-Lohman family.”
Werthan has 44 employees and generated over $5 million in sales last year.
About Sims-Lohman :
Sims-Lohman was the 90 th largest private company in Cincinnati in 2017 with $125 million in sales and 470 employees. They were also the 50 th fastest growing private Cincinnati company in 2017 as well.
The Sims-Lohman advantage includes a broad product selection, faster turnaround and a ‘one-stop’ approach for countertops and cabinets from selection through installation. They fabricate more than 15,000 granite countertops while providing the cabinetry for more than 40,000 new kitchens annually.
